means: 同情，怜悯( pity的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The performer received only pitying looks from his audience.
sentence.Network_cn: 从观众的表情看,那表演者得到的只是同情和怜悯.

sentence.Network_en: She gave him a pitying look; that was the sort of excuse her father would use.
sentence.Network_cn: 她怜悯地看了他一眼，这类借口是她父亲会用的。

sentence.Network_en: He shook his head sorrowfully, pitying himself for what had been done to him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他悲伤地摇摇头, 为自己的遭遇而自怜.

a pitying observer threw his coat around her shoulders ; let him perish without a pitying thought of ours wasted upon him-Thomas De Quincey .一个富有同情心的旁观者将自己的衣服披在了她的身上；听任他毁灭，不为我们在他身上的。

entry.tran: 表示同情（或怜悯、可怜）的
entry.def: A pitying look shows that someone feels pity and perhaps slight contempt.

example.ex: She gave him a pitying look; that was the sort of excuse her father would use.
example.tran: 她怜悯地看了他一眼，这类借口是她父亲会用的。

means.word_mean: 1. feeling or expressing sorrow or pity;

sentences.sentence: "a pitying observer threw his coat around her shoulders"
"let him perish without a pitying thought of ours wasted upon him"- Thomas De Quincey

auth_sentence.content: Paralympians don't want anyone pitying them.
